role.description: Must be an existing role name

message.example: Signup successful. Please check your email to verify your account.
Please verify your email before login.
Password reset link sent to your email address.

post.summary: Create a comment on a route

stop_id.description: Optional: Stop ID to comment on

parent_id.description: Optional: Parent comment ID for replies

body.example: Great route! Looking forward to trying it.

get.summary: Get crew members for a route

user_id.description: User ID (required if email not provided)

200.description: PDF export generated (returns JSON with download URL for API requests)
GPX export generated (returns JSON with download URL for API requests)
XLSX export generated (returns JSON with download URL for API requests)

post.summary: Create a review for a route

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search in title, description, or tags

get.summary: Get filter options for route library (regions, difficulties, seasons, available days)
get.description: Returns all available filter options that can be used in the route library. Respects user visibility permissions - authenticated users see their own routes plus public and crew-visible routes, while unauthenticated users only see public routes.

regions.description: List of unique region values from available routes

difficulties.description: List of unique difficulty levels from available routes

seasons.description: List of unique season values from available routes

available_days.description: List of unique duration days (duration_days > 0) from available routes, sorted ascending. Only includes routes visible to the user.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search in name, home_port, or builder

post.summary: Create a review for a yacht

review.example: I had an amazing time working on this yacht...

post.summary: Vote on a yacht review (helpful/not helpful)
Create a review for a marina
Create a review for a contractor
Create a review for a broker
Create a review for a restaurant

post.description: Updates the authenticated user's latitude, longitude, and location name. Automatically enables location sharing and discovery visibility when location is set.
Sets the user's online/offline status and updates the last_seen_at timestamp.

is_online.description: True to set user online, false to set offline

post.description: Finds crew members within a specified radius from given coordinates. Supports filtering by position, experience level, status, languages, and interests. Results are ordered by distance (nearest first).

radius.description: Search radius in kilometers (alternative to distance preset)

distance.description: Distance preset in kilometers (overrides radius if provided)

experience_level.description: Filter by experience level: new (0-2 years), intermediate (2-5), experienced (5-10), senior (10+ years)

status.description: Filter by status: online (currently online), available (available or looking to meet), looking_for_work (actively seeking work)

languages.description: Filter by spoken languages (array of language names)

interests.description: Filter by interests (array of interest names)

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

connection_status.description: Connection status: pending, accepted, or null if not connected

latitude.description: Only returned if user's location_privacy is 'exact'

longitude.description: Only returned if user's location_privacy is 'exact'

get.description: Returns a list of all crew members who are currently online, have location sharing enabled, and are visible in discovery. Results are limited to 50 members.

distance.description: Distance in kilometers from requesting user (if user has location set)

get.summary: Get all crew locations for map view
get.description: Retrieves all crew members with shared locations for displaying on a map. Supports filtering by position, experience level, status, and search. Can filter by radius if center coordinates are provided. Returns up to 500 results. Coordinates are returned based on user's location_privacy setting (exact, approximate, or null).

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Center point latitude for distance calculation and filtering (optional, uses user's location if not provided)

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Center point longitude for distance calculation and filtering (optional, uses user's location if not provided)

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Filter results within radius (kilometers) from center point

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by name, email, or location name

distance.description: Distance in kilometers from center point (if coordinates provided)

is_self.description: True if this is the requesting user

latitude.description: Coordinate based on location_privacy: exact (actual), approximate (offset), or null (hidden)

longitude.description: Coordinate based on location_privacy: exact (actual), approximate (offset), or null (hidden)

post.summary: Send connection request to another user
post.description: Sends a connection request to another crew member. The request will be pending until the recipient accepts or declines it. If a connection already exists between the users (in any status: pending, accepted, declined, or blocked), the request will be rejected with a 409 status. You can optionally include a personalized message and categorize the connection (e.g., 'colleague', 'friend', 'mentor').

user_id.description: ID of the user to connect with

message.description: Optional message to include with the connection request
message.example: Hi! I'd like to connect with you.

409.description: Connection request already exists - returns existing connection status

status.description: Current connection status: pending, accepted, declined, or blocked

get.description: Retrieves all pending connection requests received by the authenticated user. Returns requests ordered by most recent first. Each request includes the sender's profile information (name, email, profile photo, years of experience) and any message or category associated with the request.

post.description: Accepts a pending connection request. The connection status will be updated to 'accepted', the connected_at timestamp will be set, and both users will be able to see each other in their connections list. Only the recipient of the connection request can accept it. If the request is not in 'pending' status, the request will be rejected with a 400 status.

user.description: User information of the connection sender

post.description: Declines a pending connection request. The connection status will be updated to 'declined'. The sender will not be notified, but the connection record remains in the database with 'declined' status. Only the recipient of the connection request can decline it.

get.description: Retrieves all accepted connections for the authenticated user. Returns connections ordered by most recently connected first (based on connected_at timestamp). Each connection includes the connected user's profile information, connection category, connection strength, and timestamps for when the connection was established and last interaction occurred. Only connections with 'accepted' status are returned.

delete.description: Removes an accepted connection between the authenticated user and another user. This permanently deletes the connection record from the database. Either user in the connection can remove it. After removal, users will no longer appear in each other's connections list, but they can send a new connection request if desired.

post.description: Blocks a user and removes any existing connection (pending, accepted, or declined). A new connection record is created with 'blocked' status. Blocked users cannot send connection requests, appear in discovery results, or interact with the blocking user. The block is one-way - the blocked user will not be notified. To unblock, you would need to manually remove the blocked connection.

user_id.description: ID of the user to block

post.description: Creates a new rally (crew meetup/event). The organizer is automatically added as 'going' and the rally is published immediately. Rally types include: social (casual meetups), active (sports/activities), cultural (cultural events), professional (networking), learning (educational), and celebration (parties/celebrations). Privacy options: public (visible to all), private (only attendees can see), invite_only (requires invitation). Start date must be in the future. If coordinates are provided, the rally can be discovered via location-based search.

description.example: Join us for a networking event for yacht crew members in the Mediterranean region.

get.description: Discovers public rallies/events that are published and have a start date in the future. Supports location-based filtering (by radius in kilometers), type filtering, and date range filtering. If latitude and longitude are provided, results are ordered by distance (nearest first) and only rallies within the specified radius are returned. If no location is provided, results are ordered by start date (soonest first). Each result includes the user's current RSVP status if they have one. Only public rallies are returned in discovery - private and invite_only rallies are excluded.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Center point latitude for distance calculation

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Center point longitude for distance calculation

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Filter rallies starting from this date

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Filter rallies up to this date

user_rsvp.description: User's RSVP status: going, maybe, cant_go, interested, or null

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific rally/event, including organizer profile, attendees (going and maybe), comments with user information, and all rally details. The rally's view count is incremented when accessed. Private rallies require the user to be either the organizer or an attendee - otherwise access is denied with 403. Public and invite_only rallies are accessible to all authenticated users. The response includes the user's current RSVP status if they have one.

comments.description: List of comments on the rally

rally.description: Full rally details including organizer, attendees, and comments

user_rsvp.description: User's RSVP information if they have RSVP'd

403.description: This rally is private - user must be organizer or attendee

post.description: RSVP to a rally/event. Users can indicate they're going, maybe attending, can't go, or are interested. RSVP statuses: 'going' (confirmed attendance), 'maybe' (might attend), 'cant_go' (cannot attend), 'interested' (interested but not committed). If the rally has a maximum participant limit (max_participants) and is full (all 'going' RSVPs reached the limit), new 'going' RSVPs will be rejected with 400 status. Users can update their RSVP status at any time. Optional guests_count allows users to bring additional people. Optional comment can be included with the RSVP.

400.description: Rally is full - maximum participants limit reached

post.description: Adds a comment to a rally/event. Supports threaded comments (replies) by providing a parent_id - if parent_id is provided, the comment will be a reply to that parent comment. Comments are visible to all users who can view the rally. Maximum comment length is 1000 characters. The comment includes the user's profile information (name, email, profile photo) in the response.

comment.example: This looks great! Can't wait to attend.

parent_id.description: Optional: ID of parent comment for replies
Parent comment ID if this is a reply

comment.example: This looks great! Can't wait to attend.

bearerAuth.description: Enter your token in the format: Bearer {token}

tags.name: Crew Discovery
tags.description: Crew discovery and location-based networking endpoints. Allows users to share their location, discover nearby crew members, and manage online status. Supports filtering by position, experience level, availability status, languages, and interests. Respects user privacy settings (visibility, location_privacy).

tags.name: Crew Discovery - My Connections
tags.description: User connection management endpoints. Allows users to send connection requests, accept/decline requests, view their connections, remove connections, and block users. Connections can be categorized and have connection strength tracking.

tags.name: Crew Discovery - Rallies & Events
tags.description: Rallies and events (crew meetups) endpoints. Allows users to create, discover, and participate in rallies/events. Supports location-based discovery, RSVP management, and event comments. Rally types include: social, active, cultural, professional, learning, and celebration.
